articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Light Industrial Factories
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Light Industrial Factories
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to light industrial factories in Pyongyang.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Pyongyang Textile Mill.
					
					 He dropped in at the general control room and was briefed on the Tetron spun rayon fabrics production process. Going round several places of the Tetron spun rayon fabrics shop, he acquainted himself in detail with the production there and technological features and efficiency of the new equipment.
					
					 He looked at clothing and shirting materials made from Tetron spun rayon fabrics, cotton chequer and curtain cloth one by one and underscored the need to increase the production of clothing materials and varieties of fabrics liked by people.
					
					 He enjoyed a performance given by members of the itinerant art squad of the mill on the spot and highly appreciated their splendid performance.
					
					 He advanced important tasks facing the mill.
					
					 The second leg of his guidance was the Rakrang Ponghwa Garment Factory. 
					
					 After looking round the room devoted to the history of the factory, he dropped in at different production processes to learn in detail about its management and operation and production there. 
					
					 He praised the factory for assiduously managing its economic life, noting that though it is not long since it was commissioned, it widely introduced new technology and managed its business activities on the principle of profitability and, at the same time, waged a widespread mass technical innovation movement, thus keeping the production going at a high rate. 
					
					  It is important to increase varieties of garments and improve their quality, he noted, adding that to this end it is necessary to boost the production of varieties of garments for all seasons and favorite clothes for women's usual wear and steadily improve the quality of garment processing as required by the era by raising the skills of the workers. 
					
					 The third leg of his guidance was the Ponghwa Soup Factory.
					
					 Watching varieties of quality washing soups churning out in an endless stream, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the workers and technicians of the factory have successfully built the soup production processes to greatly contribute to the people's cultured practice in hygiene and radically increased the production by devoting their wisdom and enthusiasm.
					
					 Greatly satisfied to hear a report that "Ponghwa" washing soups are high in people's demand as they are high in their quality, he was pleased that it has become possible to provide the people with a sufficient amount of quality washing soups.
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Pyongyang Mechanical Pencil Factory.
					
					 Making the rounds of various places of the factory including the room devoted to the history of the factory and the products showcase room, he acquainted himself in detail with production and updating there.
					
					 The factory is a cutting-edge one in which all the processes from raw material feeding to packing and forwarding are streamlined, he said, praising the workers of the factory for mass-producing quality writing materials.
					
					  The officials, workers and technicians of the factory put the factory on a high level of CNC by pooling efforts with teachers and researchers at Kim Il Sung University and Kim Chaek University of Technology, he noted, adding that this shining success is a striking demonstration of the validity and vitality of the WPK's policy on attaching importance to science and technology.
					
					 Noting that reliable university students of the younger generation who received revolutionary and Juche-based education, teachers and researchers are making a breakthrough in the drive for building an economic power at the grandiose sites on the socialist front, he noted, adding that the large army of young scientists, the great pride of our party and people, are the driving force and treasure for national prosperity.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: S. Korea's Theory of "Unification through Absorption" Blasted
articles.content:
S. Korea's Theory of "Unification through Absorption" Blasted
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Disarmament and Peace Institute of the DPRK Foreign Ministry Friday issued the following statement:
					 The south Korean authorities have recently taken an ill-boding move to peddle the theory of "unification through absorption" in the international arena.
					
					 "Unifying the systems" in the reality of the Korean Peninsula precisely means "unification through absorption".
					
					 It is well known that the present authorities of south Korea adopted "unification through absorption" as a state policy from the outset and have persistently pursued it. 
					
					They advocated "no nuke, opening and 3000 dollars" right after they took office, called for instituting "unification tax" last year and advanced the proposal for achieving "three-phase unification." All this was a policy for confrontation based on "unification through absorption".
					
					 They invited ambassadors of neighboring countries to participate in the debate on unification in Seoul recently and staged a farce of advertising the above-said theory. 
					
					 Nonsensical and dangerous is the theory of "unification through absorption" touted by the present rulers of south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. and Japan lost nearly 20 years due to their repeated DPRK policy failures under the miscalculation that the DPRK would collapse just as East European countries did. It was a hard reality that they compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons in the end.
					
					 Under the situation where there is deep-rooted distrust between the north and the south and huge armed forces are standing in confrontation with each other, any attempt on the part of a side to swallow the other side up would inevitably spark a war.
					
					 The neighboring countries are required to ponder over what consequences would bring to the Korean Peninsula by their behavior agreeing to the above-said theory.
					
					 If they are truly interested in the reunification of the Korean Peninsula, they should pay attention to the proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula already solemnly clarified internally and externally by the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The said proposal of the DPRK is the best one for peaceful reunification as it guarantees feasibility and helps avert war because it presupposes the co-existence of the present systems in the north and the south.
					
					 The proposal is a reasonable one in line with the interests of the neighboring countries because it presupposes the neutrality of a unified state.
					
					 A sinister aim is lurking behind the south Korean authorities' moves to internationalize the above-said theory in a bid to make the debate on it heated. 
					
					 The so-called "waiting strategy" pursued by them in inter-Korean relations is now going bankrupt.
					
					 The international community is now aware that the tense situation on the peninsula reached the brink of war last year entirely because of the south Korean authorities' confrontation policy. It is now, therefore, becoming increasingly assertive for resuming the inter-Korean dialogue to defuse confrontation. 
					
					 Much upset by this, they are going busy to step up the debate on unification in a bid to create the impression that "contingency" is imminent in the DPRK and "unification under liberal democracy" led by them is drawing near.
					
					 Pressurized by the public at home and abroad to resume dialogue and negotiations, they are giving lip-service to "open-hearted" dialogue but, in actuality, making it impossible for dialogue to open by craftily raising unreasonable preconditions unacceptable to the DPRK.
					
					 It is a base scenario for them to justify their "waiting strategy" and bar their allies from coming out for dialogue with the DPRK or feeling any need to give humanitarian aid to it.
					
					 Those who study the reunification issue at home and abroad would be well advised to pay due attention to the truth about such debate on unification taking place in south Korea these days.

articles.title: CPRK Denounces S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign
articles.content:
CPRK Denounces S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Thursday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards the south Korean puppet group's unprecedented human rights campaign against the DPRK:
					 As already known, the puppet group invited riffraffs of the U.S. and Japan to Seoul to stage a noisy campaign from April 24 to May 1 to seriously hurt the dignity and system of the DPRK and incite confrontation with fellow countrymen under the signboard of "week for north's freedom".
					
					 Worse still, the puppet group is running the whole gamut of base moves to enact at any cost the extremely draconic "law on North Korea's human rights" which had been reduced to a dead paper by the public rebuff and condemnation. It let the puppet State Human Rights Committee stage such a burlesque as working out "a report on human rights abuses in north Korea" and making "a survey of human rights situation". It went the lengths of kicking off ridiculous diplomacy in the international arena in a bid to have an "international investigation committee" created.
					
					 This is nothing but the last-ditch effort of those driven into a tight corner by the total failure of its domestic and foreign policies and the public judgment. In the past three years of the office of the puppet group south Korea has turned into the worst tundra of human rights and democracy, touching off the towering grudge among the people against the ruling quarters.
					
					 The democratic freedom and rights are ruthlessly trampled down and people are deprived of their vital rights, plunging their living into destitution under the fascist dictatorial rule.
					
					 The south Korean people are threatened with a nuclear disaster, to say nothing of their rights, due to the reckless moves of the puppet group to escalate the confrontation with compatriots and ignite a war.
					
					 The returns of the April 27 by-election in south Korea clearly showed the bitter hatred of the south Korean public for the puppet group. 
					
					 To make matters worse, the puppet group's reckless moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and nuclear racket against it only rendered the group further isolated at home and abroad.
					
					 Through its anti-DPRK human rights campaign the puppet group seeks a sinister aim to divert elsewhere the south Korean public's criticism of it and intensify the anti-DPRK smear campaign under the pretext of human rights in a bid to recover from its failure of the above-said policy and nuclear racket and thus tarnish the dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 It is the height of folly for the puppet conservative group to kick up an anti-DPRK human rights campaign in a bid to hurt the socialist system centred on the popular masses in the DPRK though it is standing public trial for having reduced south Korea to a graveyard of human rights.
					
					 The more vociferous the puppet group is becoming over the non-existent "human rights" issue of someone, the more saliently it will reveal its true colors as a group of maniacs seeking confrontation with fellow countrymen and anti-reunification elements.
					
					 The Korean people will never pardon but severely punish those who try to do harm to the dignity and system of the DPRK even a bit.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets New South African Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets New South African Ambassador 
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun had a talk with Bheki Winston Joshua Langa, new South African ambassador to the DPRK, on Friday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: 14th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair to Open
articles.content:
14th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair to Open
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The 14th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair will take place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition from May 16 to 19.
					 It will bring together more than 280 companies from the DPRK, China, Germany, Malaysia, Mongolia, Brazil, Syria, Switzerland, Singapore, Britain, Australia, Austria, Italy, Indonesia, India, Poland and Taipei of China.
					
					 Presented to the fair will be more than 5,600 kinds of products including CNC machine tools, electric and electronic products, light industrial goods, foodstuffs and medicines, chemical goods and vehicles.

articles.title: Briefing on Young RC Volunteers' Activities Held
articles.content:
Briefing on Young RC Volunteers' Activities Held
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A briefing on the Red Cross activities of young volunteers took place in Anju City, South Phyongan Province, on Thursday.
					 Present at the briefing were officials of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society and its South Phyongan Provincial Branch Office, young volunteers and members of delegations of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) and the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) working in Pyongyang.
					
					 Young volunteers had a question-and-answer session concerning the prevention of traffic accidents and gave an explanation of traffic rules and an art performance.
					
					 Igor Dmitryuk, head of the delegation of the IFRC, emphasized the need to invigorate activities to prevent traffic accidents, saying that according to the latest statistics, more than one and half million people die in road accidents in the world every year.

articles.title: Architectural Festival Held
articles.content:
Architectural Festival Held
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The 11th May 21 Architectural Festival was held here from May 3 to 6.
					 The festival proceeded in such forms as prize contests of city formation planning and architectural design, design for updating light industrial factories and dwelling house design, public presentation of scientific papers on architecture and construction and competition for producing architectural designing program and multi-media.
					
					 Presented to it were at least 200 pieces of works for architectural design prize contest, more than 230 scientific papers and over 30 architectural designing programs and multi-media selected at provincial and city architectural festivals.
					
					 Drawing visitors were designs of the central part of Pyongyang, provincial, city and county seat formation blueprints suited to the features of local areas as they showed well the architecture development in the era of Songun..
					
					 Designs of large flower gardens and fountain parks and various decoration designs were produced in a peculiar way.
					
					 Its closing ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture Friday.
					
					 Present there were Pae Tal Jun, minister of State Construction Control, Pak Kil U, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Union of Architects of Korea, and officials, architects, technicians, teachers and researchers in the architecture and construction fields.

articles.title: New Book Published
articles.content:
New Book Published 
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out the book "Revolutionary History of Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" (enlarged edition) compiled by the Party History Institute of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The book dealing with the glorious revolutionary life and exploits of President Kim Il Sung has 12 chapters written in chronological order.
					
					 Chapters from 1 to 4 which cover the period from April of 1912 to August of 1945 contain the revolutionary history in which the President grew up as a great revolutionary, founded the immortal Juche idea, the Songun idea, started the revolutionary cause of Juche and led the anti-Japanese war to liberate Korea to victory.
					
					 Chapters from 5 to 8 which cover the period from August of 1945 to December of 1960 tell the historical facts that the President led to victory the building of a new country and the Fatherland Liberation War, wisely led the struggle for the post-war rehabilitation and construction and the laying of the foundation of socialism and established the Korean-style socialist system centered on popular masses.
					
					 Chapters from 9 to 12 cover the period from January of 1961 to July of 1994. They deal with the historical facts that the President wisely led socialist construction, building a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, and demonstrating its dignity and might before the world.
					
					 The book deals with facts that Kim Il Sung rendered positive support, political, military and material, to the people of various countries including China in their struggle against the imperialists and sent many technicians and experts to different countries to sincerely help them in their economic and cultural construction.
					
					 The book also tells stories that Kim Il Sung was presented with orders and honorary titles and gifts by the Korean people, overseas compatriots and world progressives for the great exploits performed for the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					It says that Kim Il Sung is always alive as the sun of Juche thanks to the noble revolutionary moral obligation of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK recently issued a sheetlet reflecting the development of circus in the country. 
					 The sheetlet contains pictures of acrobatic feats like "Rope-skipping" and "Mouth-balance in Flight".
					
					 Korean acrobats have proved successful at the Monte Carlo, Wuqiao of China and other international acrobatics festivals.

articles.title: New Health Foodstuffs Developed
articles.content:
New Health Foodstuffs Developed
						
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry has developed various kinds of health foodstuffs.
					 Tea made of bellflower roots with their flavor and medicinal ingredients well preserved, is efficacious for removing sputum and lowering high blood pressure and fever.
					
					 Vinegar made of fermented bellflower roots is potent for high blood pressure, fatigue, aging, cancer, heart trouble and cough. It, which contains microelements, macroelements and various vitamins, improves physiological function. 
					
					 Another health foodstuff is savory cake made of fermented beans, mixed with mung bean, glutinous rice, honey, fruit of Crataegus pinnatifida, sesame and taffy. 
					
					 It activates the brain function and has a virtue for liver trouble, poisoning, diabetes, colitis, cardiovascular disease and cerebral thrombosis.

articles.title: Compound Microorganisms Used in Breeding Eel
articles.content:
Compound Microorganisms Used in Breeding Eel
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The Taedonggang Eel Farm in Korea has used compound microorganisms in breeding eel.
					 The compound microorganisms help lower the feed consumption and prevent epidemics, while raising eels' viability and weight 8 percent and 22.3 percent respectively.
					
					 The bacteria promote the growth and metabolism of the fish and improve its immune function.
					
					 They include antagonistic germs efficacious for preventing and exterminating epidemics, as well as various kinds of germs good for digestion.

articles.title: Rungna Islet Pleasure Resort
articles.content:
Rungna Islet Pleasure Resort
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Many people enjoy themselves on Rungna Islet in Pyongyang.
					 Rungna Islet is floating in the middle of the River Taedong flowing across Pyongyang.
					
					 The islet, famous for a willow grove, is one of the pleasure resorts in the city. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung visited the islet in May Juche 55 (1966) and called for turning it into a recreation ground.
					
					 The resort includes a boating ground, open-air swimming pool, football ground, tennis court and other sports and welfare service facilities.
					
					 It also boasts of the May Day Stadium, which has been well known as the venue of the 13th World Festival of Youth and Students and the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".
					
					 A grand magic performance is going on at the stadium.

articles.title: Medieval Music Book of Korea
articles.content:
Medieval Music Book of Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Akhakgwebom is a music book dating back to the medieval ages.
					 It, compiled by Jangakwon (royal court music organ) in 1493, consists of nine volumes in three parts -- theory, practice and instrument -- and deals with theories and achievements concerning music and dance art.
					
					 The theory part introduces basic musical principles like twelve tones and tunes based on them, and different artistic forms applied to court music and folk music.
					
					 The practice part gives an illustrated explanation of difference between court music and folk music, their development, and performing forms and routines of instrumentals and dance music for royal ceremonies. It also contains many songs, music and dance pieces and instrumentals created in a long period from the days of Koryo kingdom.
					
					 The instrument part gives an illustrated instruction of music instruments, costume, and stage setting and properties.
					
					 The book also introduces music notation invented in Korea and music and dance heritages of other countries.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korea for Trying to Repeat Yongphyong Shelling Case
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korea for Trying to Repeat Yongphyong Shelling Case
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group committed naval firing drills on Paekryong Island and Yonphyong Island in the West Sea of Korea on Tuesday.
					 Involved in the drills staged under the pretext of coping with someone's "provocation" were fighters, patrol ships and other air and naval forces. At least ten officers of the U.S. forces were invited to observe them. 
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling case last year created a touch-and-go situation between the north and the south of Korea and the wounds inflicted upon Koreans are still left unhealed. They cannot repress resentment at the south Korean puppet forces who are keen to repeat the shelling exercises there.
					
					 The "Cheonan" warship sinking case, the hideous conspiratorial case, and the Yongphyong Island shelling case seriously affected the national reconciliation and unity as they were provocations to the DPRK, products of the reckless ambition of the hostile forces to invade it.
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean puppet group has ceaselessly introduced a lot of modern military equipment into areas along the maritime demarcation line in the West Sea including Yongphyong Island and is staging military exercises in these areas almost every day, watching for a chance to provoke the DPRK. This is evidenced by the fact that it kicked off war hysteria, firing various types of artillery pieces into the waters off Paekryong Island and Yonphyong Island in March and it is talking about "diverse provocations" of someone in a bid to create the impression that it is exposed to great threat. 
					
					 Through such military confrontation as firing exercises on Yongphyong Island the south Korean military seeks to cast chill on the public opinion at home and abroad calling for the detente on the Korean Peninsula and improving the inter-Korean relations and ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean belligerent forces would be well advised to stop their rash acts.
					
					 Those who seek danger are bound to perish therein.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Forces Urged to Halt Arms Build-up against Compatriots
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Forces Urged to Halt Arms Build-up against Compatriots 
						
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- It is impossible to create an atmosphere for improving the north-south relations unless the moves for confrontation and a war against fellow countrymen are terminated in south Korea. Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article. This is proved by the lapse of three years since the conservative forces came to power in south Korea, the article notes, and goes on:
					 Those forces have further intensified the above-said moves with each passing day to do harm to compatriots. 
					
					 What frantic moves these forces have stepped up to bolster up the armed forces for invading the north find a vivid manifestation in the fact that the funds spent for arms purchase with the money collected from the people as taxes steadily swelled every year. 
					
					 The bellicose nature of the ruling conservative forces was brought to light by the fact that they have staged madcap joint military exercises with outside forces almost every day since the outset of their office. 
					
					 The number of the joint military exercises staged by the conservative authorities in collusion with outside forces over the last three years under diverse codenames steadily increased: 31 in 2008, 37 in 2009 and 50 in 2010. 
					
					 From the beginning of their office they revived the "theory of principal enemy" and recklessly incited consciousness of confrontation with fellow countrymen throughout the society, letting loose such provocative remarks as "preemptive attack" on the north and "retaliation and punishment." They also persistently conducted an anti-DPRK psychological warfare including reckless scattering of leaflets on the west coast and the central and eastern areas along the Military Demarcation Line. 
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling incident in which shells were fired into the inviolable territorial waters of the DPTK despite its repeated warnings and all what happened in the subsequent period bring to light the wild ambition of the conservative forces for invading the north. 
					
					 However, the conservative authorities' moves to escalate the confrontation and start a war would not show them a way out but precipitate their self-destruction.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" Slammed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" Slammed
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The president of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan and tens of Dietmen recently visited "Yasukuni Shrine" to incite militarism.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says in a signed commentary:
					
					 Japanese politicians including the party leader and Dietmen vied with each other to visit the shrine on the "spring festival" and prayed for the souls of the dead who were sternly punished by history for their madcap overseas aggression in the past. This is a dangerous act to revive the soul of militarism.
					
					 The Japanese right-wing conservative politicians are putting forward the war criminals of the Japanese imperialists who committed inhuman crimes in the past as "patriots". This is a ruse to revive militarism and launch reinvasion.
					
					 It is quite natural for the international public circles including Asian countries to rebuff and assail the said visit as a militarist racket.
					
					 At a time when the Japanese people are suffering big pain and wrapped in uneasiness and terror due to the unexpected massive disasters, many Japanese politicians herded to the shrine again. This is a folly which can be done only by the militarist maniacs.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are now openly working to tamper with history and grab Tok Islets. They are not only embellishing all the past crimes as "just" and "righteous" but also claiming that the islets belong to "Japan". This goes to prove that they are working with blood-shot eyes to carry out their ambition for territorial expansion and reinvasion.
					
					 They would be well advised to act with reason, clearly understanding that their reckless moves for revival of militarism and reinvasion is as foolish an act as throwing Japan into a pitfall of destruction.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Blocking Inter-Korean Economic Cooperation
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Blocking Inter-Korean Economic Cooperation
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- South Korean businessmen bitterly accused the "government" of blocking inter-Korean economic cooperation at the "National Assembly" on April 29.
					 Kim Yong Il, advisor to the Consultative Council for South-North Trade and Investment of the Trade Association of south Korea, deplored that they are living the lowest life, forsaken by the "government". He went on:
					
					A man in authority who conceived "no nuke, opening and 3000 dollars" openly told me not to conduct economic cooperation.
					
					 Businessmen who participated in economic cooperation with the north worked hard to keep business afloat though they found themselves in such miserable plight as to greet each other every morning "How is your wife? Didn't your wife run away?" The Ministry of Unification dashed even that hope.
					
					 "We label the Ministry of Unification a lion in the other world," he said with indignation. 
					
					 The session of the NA that day was also attended by the authorities of the ministry but the businessmen in despair were more bitterly angered as they seemed not to listen to their appeal.
					
					 This indicates that the resentment at the authorities has reached its height in the south Korean society as they have not paid any heed to the call of the public at home and abroad for dialogue and cooperation, keen to realize the daydream of "unifying the systems."

articles.title: Prosecution's Flattery to Power Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prosecution's Flattery to Power Accused in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on May 2 carried an editorial censuring the prosecution for its base act of fawning on the conservative power. It said:
					 The prosecution indicted members of the Teachers Trade Union and the Government Employees Union en masse for their relation with the Democratic Labor Party last year. And it appealed against the judgment of acquittal given to them in January this year.
					
					 In the meantime, it hushed up the recent case of a teacher related to the "Grand National Party", claiming that there was nothing particular and the period allowed for appeal had passed.
					
					 Recalling the facts, the editorial said that such behaviors show the attitude of the prosecution studying only the pleasure of the power.
					
					 It urged the prosecution to lend an ear to the popular masses' opinion.

articles.title: Repression of Candlelight Actions Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Candlelight Actions Flayed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Citizens Political Action on May 2 launched a signature campaign in protest against the puppet authorities' unreasonable suppression of the participants in the candlelight actions.
					The authorities are trying to inflict criminal punishment on more than 1,400 persons for the mere reason that they took part in the candlelight actions against the American beef import in 2008, the organization charged.
					
					 The large-scale candlelight actions at that time were a just protest of the people from all walks of life against the unilateral policy of the "government", it said.
					
					 The organization said that it would stand against the repressive step of the authorities branding the participants in the candlelight actions as "criminals".

articles.title: Korean People's Cause Supported by Namibian President
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause Supported by Namibian President
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The friendly relations between Namibia and the DPRK were provided long ago by President Sam Nujoma and President Kim Il Sung, said Namibian President Hifikepunye Pohamba on April 29.
					 In his meeting with outgoing DPRK Ambassador to Namibia An Hui Jong, the Namibian president noted that the Korean people rendered material and mental assistance to the Namibian people in the struggle for independence and building of a new society.
					
					 The Namibian people are convinced that the Korean people are now facing such various difficulties and challenges as sanctions by the imperialists but will surely overcome them, defend the sovereignty and win victory, he stressed.

articles.title: Solidarity with DPRK Expressed by Int'l Body
articles.content:
Solidarity with DPRK Expressed by Int'l Body
						
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A resolution on solidarity with the DPRK was adopted at the 16th Congress of the World Federation of Trade Unions held in Athens from April 6 to 10.
					 The world progressives and working people unanimously hope that the north and the south of Korea will realize the independent reunification by means of federation, the most fair and realistic proposal, in the idea of "By our nation itself" and advance toward peace and prosperity, the resolution said.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula has been put in the touch-and-go situation entirely due to the U.S., it pointed out, saying: The participants in the congress bitterly denounce the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and the south Korean conservative authorities' moves against the DPRK and reunification.
					
					 It strongly demanded that the U.S. stop at once the arms buildup, military interference and war exercises increasing the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula, replace the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty and withdraw its troops from south Korea immediately.
					
					 We strongly urge the south Korean authorities to abandon their sycophancy toward the U.S. and consciousness of confrontation with fellow countrymen, respect the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and opt for improving the inter-Korean relations, the resolution said.
					
					 It expressed full support for the DPRK in its efforts to remove the danger of war prevailing on the peninsula, defend peace and security and improve the inter-Korean relations.
					
					We recognize the original Songun politics of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as the most reliable mode of politics that helps avert a war and defend peace on the peninsula and achieve the independent reunification of the country and prosperity of the nation, it said.
					
					 The resolution expressed full support and solidarity with the workers and other people of the DPRK in their efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Group's Inhuman Acts Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Group's Inhuman Acts Slammed
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK in a statement on April 28 denounced the south Korean puppet conservative group for having kidnapped inhabitants of the DPRK in the West Sea of Korea.
					 The group kidnapped 31 inhabitants of the DPRK who were put in the unfavorable situation due to the bad weather after leaving Tongpho-ri, Kangryong County, South Hwanghae Province to catch shellfish and inflicted psychological and mental sufferings on them through operation to force them to "defect" to the south, the statement charged.
					
					 The group repatriated 27 inhabitants in late March but has still detained four persons, asserting that they decided to remain in the south, it pointed out.
					
					 Condemning the group for its violation of human rights, the statement strongly demanded that it send back as early as possible the four inhabitants of the DPRK illegally detained in south Korea.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Observed by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Observed by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Russian and Polish papers commemorated the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					  The 4th issue of the Russian paper Poditiya carried an article titled "The DPRK relying on self-reliance", which noted that the President advanced the idea of giving full play to the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance at the dawn of the Korean revolution and had thoroughly applied it in all fields.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il a brisk drive for modernization is being pushed forward in different fields of the DPRK and innovations are being effected in agriculture, too, the paper said, adding: Many developing countries are learning from the DPRK's experience in socialist construction.
					
					 The Polish paper Gazeta Wyborcza on April 15 carried a photo-illustrated article under the headline of "99th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung", which showed the Korean people significantly commemorating the Day of the Sun as the greatest holiday of the nation.

articles.title: KPA Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
KPA Praised by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries carried special write-ups to mark the 79th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 The Lao paper Congtap Pasason Lao on April 25 carried a photo of leader Kim Jong Il inspecting a KPA unit and an article on the factor of invincibility of the KPA.
					
					 The article elaborated on the Juche-based military idea and strategy, source of invincible strength of the KPA, and its politico-ideological might, the army-people great unity and the tremendous military technological might of the KPA. 
					
					 The Cambodian paper Pracheachon on April 24 carried a photo of Kim Jong Il watching KPA soldiers in training and an article praising the might of the invincible revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The Vietnamese paper Quan Doi Nhan Dan on April 25 carried an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il's view on armed forces" with a photo showing the KPA soldiers' spirit of annihilating the enemy.
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il has the soldier-centered view on armed forces, the article said, adding that under his leadership the KPA has been fully prepared to reliably defend their country under any situation.

articles.title: Distrust Shown in Japanese PM's Ability to Handle Crisis
articles.content:
Distrust Shown in Japanese PM's Ability to Handle Crisis
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The local authorities of Japan are becoming increasingly distrustful of the Prime Minister's ability to cope with the crisis.
					 Over 60 percent of the respondents negatively estimated the countermeasures taken by the prime minister to bring the situation at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant under control, according to the results of the opinion poll recently conducted by the Kyodo News Service among its bureaus across the country.

articles.title: Future of Country and Nation Depends on Youth--Chinese Premier
articles.content:
Future of Country and Nation Depends on Youth--Chinese Premier
 Beijing, May 4 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao met with youth representatives from all walks of life in Beijing at Zhongnanhai on Tuesday on the eve of China's Youth Day.
					 The future of the country and the nation depends on youth, he said, adding that the destiny of youth precisely means the destiny of the Chinese nation and the future of youth precisely means the future of the state.
					
					 He stressed the need for the young people to play the role of shock brigade in all fields with high ambition.

articles.title: Book on Guidelines of 12th Five-Year Plan Published in China
articles.content:
Book on Guidelines of 12th Five-Year Plan Published in China
						
 Beijing, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Publishing House recently released book on guidelines of the 12th Five-Year Plan for China's national economy and social development.
					 The book explains the major contents of the guidelines and systematically deals with the guiding principle, development target, major tasks, political steps, etc. laid down in the guidelines.

articles.title: Test Flight of New Type Fighter Made in Russia
articles.content:
Test Flight of New Type Fighter Made in Russia
						
 Moscow, May 4 (KCNA) -- The first test flight of Cy-35C, new type multi-purpose fighter, was made at an airport in Komsomolsk-na-Amure City, Russia on May 3.
					 This highly modern fighter is equipped with the fifth generation technological system more advantageous than fighters of the same class.
					
					 It is reported that this new type fighter will be delivered to the Ministry of Defense after more several test flights.

articles.title: Tajik President on International Terrorism Faked Up by World's Big Powers
articles.content:
Tajik President on International Terrorism Faked Up by World's Big Powers
						
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Tajik President Emomali Rahmon on April 29 said that international terrorism is one myth faked up by the world's big powers.
					 He warned big powers of the attempt to expand the aftereffect of instability in the Middle East to the whole areas of the world.

articles.title: Iran Accuses US of Its Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
Iran Accuses US of Its Human Rights Abuses
 Tehran, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesperson said in a recent press conference that U.S. officials are not competent to comment on human rights issues.
					 He called the United States the "greatest violator of human rights", saying that U.S. officials have not yet been able to provide an answer to the public opinion about human rights abuses being committed at Abu Ghraib and Guantanamo penitentiaries.
					
					 "They (U.S. officials) are using the human rights issue as a tool to exert pressure on independent countries," he added.

articles.title: Iran Supports Palestinian Unity Efforts
articles.content:
Iran Supports Palestinian Unity Efforts
						
 Tehran, May 4 (KCNA) -- Head of Iran's Majlis (Parliament) National Security and Foreign Policy Commission Alaeddin Boroujerdi said in an interview with a TV radio Tuesday that Tehran supports reconciliation between Palestinian political parties Hamas and Fatah.
					 Fatah and Hamas reached an agreement on reconciliation, he said, adding this development is a leap forward towards the decline of the Zionist regime (of Israel).
					
					 The United States and its allies are not pleased with the agreement reached between Fatah and Hamas, he said.

articles.title: Indonesia Welcomes Reconciliation between Factions in Palestine
articles.content:
Indonesia Welcomes Reconciliation between Factions in Palestine
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian Foreign Ministry in a statement on May 3 clarified the stand of the country supporting the efforts of the Palestinians to achieve national unity.
					 The government of Indonesia welcomes the reconciliation between factions in Palestine, the statement noted.
					
					 It said that the reconciliation is a principal element for Palestinians' struggle to build an independent state of Palestine.

articles.title: Sudanese Ruling Party Discloses US Deceitfulness
articles.content:
Sudanese Ruling Party Discloses US Deceitfulness
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A senior official of the Sudanese National Congress (ruling party) at a press conference Sunday condemned the United States for its deceitfulness. 
					 The Sudanese government has sincerely implemented all its commitments with Southern Sudan including the peace agreement, but the U.S. is seeking to wrest bigger concession from the Sudanese government against its promise, he said.
					
					 He urged the U.S. to unconditionally honor its commitments over the Sudanese issue.

articles.title: Foodstuff Price Rises in Central Asian Countries
articles.content:
Foodstuff Price Rises in Central Asian Countries
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Foodstuff price in Central Asian countries rose 17 percent on an average last year.
					 Conveying this recently, the World Bank assumed that the foodstuff price will steadily rise in the countries of this region this year.

articles.title: 5.0-Magnitude Quake Hits Vanuatu
articles.content:
5.0-Magnitude Quake Hits Vanuatu 
						
 Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.0 on the Richter scale jolted Vanuatu on May 2.
					 The epicenter was waters northeastern of the Islands.

articles.title: MINREX rechaza nuevo intento de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
MINREX rechaza nuevo intento de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ATCC) -- El portavoz del Instituto de Desarme y Paz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la República Popular Democrática de Corea hizo pública el día 6 la siguiente declaración:
					En estos tiempos, levantan sospechas los movimientos de las autoridades surcoreanas para plantear en la escena internacional la teoría de "reunificación mediante la fusión de regímenes" que significa prácticamente en la Península Coreana la "reunificación mediante la absorción". 
					
					Ya está conocido que las actuales autoridades surcoreanas politizaron y persiguieron persistentemente esa teoría desde el principio de su mandato. 
					
					La "desnuclearización, la apertura y 3000 dólares" -doctrina presentada al principio de su mandato-, el "impuesto de reunificación" y la teoría de "reunificación de tres etapas" -planteados el año pasado- han sido políticas conflictivas que suponen la "reunificación mediante la absorción".
					
					Hace poco, las autoridades surcoreanas incorporaron a los embajadores de países vecinos en la discusión sobre la reunificación realizada en Seúl y anunciaron la teoría de "reunificación mediante la absorción" que es una ilusión absurda y peligrosa. 
					
					Debido a la equivocación de que la RPDC se derrumbaría también como los países de Europa Oriental, EE.UU. y Japón perdieron 20 años cometiendo errores sucesivos en su política sobre la primera y por fin, no tuvieron otro resultado que empujarla a la posesión de armas nucleares. 
					
					Existe una desconfianza profunda entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea que se enfrentan con enormes fuerzas armadas. En tal circunstancia, si una parte intenta devorar a la contraparte, será inevitable la guerra. 
					
					Los países vecinos deben reflexionar seriamente de las consecuencias que traiga a la Península Coreana su adherencia a la teoría en cuestión. 
					
					Si ellos están interesados de veras en la reunificación de la Península Coreana, tendrían que prestar atención al proyecto de reunificación mediante el sistema federal, aclarado solemnemente al interior y el exterior del país mediante la Declaración Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio. 
					
					Este proyecto es el mejor y racional remedio para prevenir la guerra y conviene a los intereses de los países vecinos porque toma por premisa la coexistencia de los regímenes existentes en el Norte y el Sur y el neutralismo del Estado reunificado. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas pretenden internacionalizar la discusión sobre la "reunificación mediante la absorción" para alcanzar su siniestro objetivo. 
					
					Ahora está condenada al fracaso la llamada "estrategia de espera" que persiguen ellas en las relaciones Norte-Sur. 
					
					La sociedad internacional se dio cuenta de que la causa de las tensiones de la Península Coreana, que en el año pasado, habían llegado al borde de guerra, reside en la política conflictiva del Sur de Corea y alza las voces en demanda de la eliminación del ambiente de confrontación mediante la reanudación del diálogo entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					Para salir del atolladero, las autoridades surcoreanas intentan activar la discusión sobre la reunificación para dar la impresión de que es inminente la "situación de emergencia" en la RPDC y se aproxima la reunificación bajo el "sistema democrático liberal" y con el protagonismo de sí mismas. 
					
					Presionadas por nacionales y extranjeras para que reanudaran el diálogo y negociaciones, dicen por una parte que "su alma está abierta" al diálogo y por la otra, lo impiden presentando taimadamente las injustas condiciones nunca aceptables para la RPDC. 
					
					De esta manera, quieren realizar su sucio intento de justificar su "estrategia de espera" y convencer a sus aliados para que consideren innecesarios el diálogo con la RPDC o los suministros de cooperación humanitaria. 
					
					Los estudiosos nacionales y extranjeros del problema de reunificación deberán prestar debida atención a lo que hay detrás de las discusiones sobre la reunificación que se abren últimamente en el Sur de Corea.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia escalada de campa?a anti-RPDC en tema de DDHH
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia escalada de campaña anti-RPDC en tema de DDHH
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ATCC) -- Con respecto a que se torna más brutal que nunca la campaña anti-República Popular Democrática de Corea de los títeres surcoreanos en el campo de DDHH, el portavoz del Comité por la Reunificación Pacífica de la Patria (CRPP) dio el día 5 la siguiente respuesta a la ATCC:
					Como ya trascendidos, desde el 24 de abril al primero de mayo, la camarilla de títeres surcoreanos celebró en Seúl la "semana de libertad del Norte" y otras actividades, que insultaron gravemente la dignidad y el régimen de la RPDC y fomentaron el enfrentamiento fratricida, invitando a las chusmas de Estados unidos y Japón. 
					
					Además, actúa suciamente para restablecer la "ley de derechos humanos del Norte" que se ha hecho un papel mojado siendo repudiada por la opinión pública.
					
					De otro lado, por conducto de la Comisión de DDHH del Sur de Corea, escenifica las payasadas como "declaración de daños" e "investigación de la situación de DDHH del Norte", y lleva este asunto hasta al escenario internacional reclamando la instalación del llamado "comité internacional de investigación". 
					
					Tales maniobras significan el último coletazo de los que se encuentran en un atolladero sin salida por el fracaso total de su política interior y exterior y por las críticas de la opinión pública. 
					
					Durante 3 años de mandato del poder actual, el Sur de Corea se ha convertido en el infierno de DDHH y de democracia y está a punto de explotar el resentimiento del pueblo contra los gobernantes. 
					
					Debido a la dominación de dictadura fascista, resultaron suprimidos flagrantemente la libertad y los derechos democráticos y el pueblo vive en extrema miseria siendo privado del derecho a la vida.
					
					Para colmo, los habitantes surcoreanos corren el riesgo nuclear por las imprudentes maniobras conflictivas y bélicas de la banda de títeres surcoreanos. 
					
					El resultado de las elecciones suplementarias realizadas el 27 de abril demostró claramente a qué grado llegó la cólera de la población. 
					
					Ahora los títeres surcoreanos están aislados dentro y fuera del país por sus frenéticas maniobras de confrontación anti-RPDC y alboroto nuclear. 
					
					Por eso, lanzaron la campaña de DDHH anti-RPDC con la malsana intención de calmar a la población indignada y distraer la atención de la opinión pública.
					
					Atemorizados por el inminente fracaso total de su política conflictiva con la RPDC y campaña nuclear contra ésta, quieren alcanzar otra meta política de mellar la dignidad de ella mediante la ofensiva en el tema de DDHH. 
					
					¡Qué ridícula es esta ofensiva contra el régimen socialista centrado en las masas populares de la RPDC!
					
					Si la camarilla surcoreana sigue cuestionando el inexistente problema de "DDHH" de la RPDC, el mundo verá más claramente la naturaleza conflictiva y anti-reunificación de esa horda. 
					
					El pueblo coreano castigará rotundamente a los que se atrevan a atentar contra la dignidad y el régimen de la RPDC.

articles.title: ¿Por qué intentan repetir el caso de Yonphyong? -comentario de ATCC-
articles.content:
¿Por qué intentan repetir el caso de Yonphyong? -comentario de ATCC-
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ATCC) -- Los títeres surcoreanos cometieron el día 3 en las islas Paekryong y Yonphyong del Mar Oeste de Corea un entrenamiento de tiro bajo el pretexto de hacer frente a la "provocación" de alguien. 
					En ese ejercicio se movilizaron las fuerzas aéreas y marítimas, incluso aviones de combate y barcos patrulleros, y lo vieron más de 10 oficiales norteamericanos. 
					
					El incidente de cañonazos en la isla Yonphyong, que había creado el año pasado una situación muy tirante en las relaciones íntercoreanas, sigue siendo una herida para la nación coreana. Sin embargo, los títeres surcoreanos desarrollaron en el mismo lugar otro ejercicio de artillería, lo cual provoca gran indignación. 
					
					El incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y el caso de la isla Yonphyong, complots nunca vistos, son actos provocativos contra la RPDC, que se derivaron de la ambición de las fuerzas hostiles de agredirla, y causaron graves consecuencias en la reconciliación y la unidad de la nación. 
					
					Sin embargo, los títeres surcoreanos introdujeron incesantemente muchos pertrechos bélicos modernos en la isla Yonphyong y otras zonas alrededores de la línea de demarcación militar marítima y libraron ahí casi todos los días los ejercicios militares acechando la oportunidad de provocar. 
					
					A citar ejemplos, en marzo pasado, realizaron un tiroteo de cañones de diferentes tipos en las aguas periféricas de las islas Paekryong y Yonphyong y al hablar con bombo y platillo de la "provocación variada" de alguien, engañan a la opinión pública como si ellos fueran amenazados de gravedad.
					
					De esta manera, quieren envenenar la opinión pública interna y externa, que exige aliviar la tensión de la Península Coreana y mejorar las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, y desatar finalmente la guerra de agresión a la RPDC. 
					
					Los belicistas surcoreanos deben actuar con prudencia teniendo presente que el que prefiere el fuego muere en llamas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia visita al "Santuario Yasukuni" en Japón
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia visita al "Santuario Yasukuni" en Japón 
						
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el presidente del Partido Democrático Liberal de Japón y decenas de parlamentarios japoneses visitaron en colectivo el "Santuario Yasukuni". 
					Los politiqueros japoneses oraron ahí por los criminales de guerra, que murieron siendo castigados severamente por la historia por haber cometido tremendos crímenes de lesa humanidad en las agresiones a ultramar del siglo pasado, idolatrándolos como "patriotas".
					
					En un comentario individual de este vienes, el diario Rodong Sinmun lo califica de acto peligroso para resucitar el fantasma de militarismo y continúa: 
					
					Es muy natural que la sociedad internacional, en particular los países asiáticos, denunciara la visita de reaccionarios japoneses al "Santuario Yasukuni" como locura militarista.
					
					Los politiqueros japoneses cometieron esa locura justamente cuando se desataron el pánico y el pavor en su país por el gran terremoto. 
					
					Ahora los reaccionarios japoneses impulsan abiertamente la tergiversación de la historia y el proyecto para arrebatar el islote Tok. 
					
					En ese contexto, califican todos los crímenes del pasado como "justos" y "legítimos" y se obstinan en su soberanía sobre el islote Tok. 
					
					Este hecho comprueba que ellos están desesperados por satisfacer su ambición de expansión territorial y nueva agresión. 
					
					Les sería conveniente que se vuelvan en sí dejándose de tales acciones suicidas.
